TopicTitle: [Operator error or something else] version 0.90 wont take mods.

Articles.Content:
This is a list of mods I have installed. PROPERLY!! I followed all instructions and looked for solutions. Sometimes the game seems like its going to work. It lets me build a ship or whatever, but then right in the middle of it, the game crashes. The list of mods is as follows.

  • 000_USITools
  • CommunityResourcePack
  • EditorExtensions
  • Firespitter
  • KAS (kerbal attachment system)
  • KerbalScienceFoundation
  • MechJeb2
  • ModuleRCSFX
  • Regolith
  • RLA_Stockalike
  • ShipManifest
  • SpaceY-Lifters
  • UmbraSpaceIndustries (with freight transportation technologies, and Kerbal Kolonization parts mods inside)

I used to have more, but this is the only combination that actually loads to the title screen.

maybe its the fact that I have to many? But I have tried reducing the number of mods. And it doesn't help. I've checked versions religiously, and even went as far as to download the version checker doohickey and it says its all good. Ive tried with and without module manager. In the past it seemed to load more smoothly with module manager. (not sure if i was imagining it... probably)

So basically what i want to get out of this post is, either a explanation. Or maybe someone can walk me through the process of Reverting back to a previous version of KSP. Because when i had 0.25 I had absolutely no problems what so ever. I could load as many or as little mods that i wanted. No hiccups.

(i have multiple crash reports, but I am unable to read them. Is it possible to read these reports to find out exactly what is happening to the game???)

i know for a fact that firespitter hasn't been updated to 0.90. that is probably one of the things causing it

Edit: i forgot to mention, this may have been just me, but i think most of the firespitter comments are about the fact that it doesn't work, did you download all these mods from Curse?

Edited December 27, 2014 by Mr Tiddles

Moved the Support (modded installs) forum, where the right people may see it.

First, please read the How to Get Support sticky and provide the requested information, particularly your output log and mod versions.

thank u so much... i was having the hardest time searching every single page of a thread. some of them have like 400 pages. LOL anyway, YES thank u much. +100000000000000000000
